title: Theodoros offers a dedication to Serapis
support: Part of a fine white limestone block, forming the base of a statue (two circular holes, 5.5cm in diameter, are visible in the front part of the upper surface, the left c.5 cm from the front, the right c.7.5 cm from the front; the right hole is incomplete). The block is intact on top, as well as on the front and left; it is broken at the rear and on the right; c.14 cm high. Perhaps half the block is lost on the right. The face is damaged on the left, and below, as well as on the right, with minor damage along the top edge.

layout.p: Greek text is visible on three lines, as much as half the text lost on the right side.

handNote.lettering: The letters are deeply and broadly cut with plain strokes lacking serifs. Omega is closed and slightly ovoid; omicron is full size.

provenanceFound._: Found in the section of the trench on the west side of the so-called ‘muro a bugnato’, which borders the main street and the area of the so-called ‘lower agora’, to the north-east of the main agora

provenanceObserved._: On display in the lapidarium on site

facsimile.desc: Photo J.Prag courtesy Soprintendenza BBCCAA di Messina

repository._: Antiquarium e sito archeologico di Halaesa

museum.name: Antiquarium e sito archeologico di Halaesa
museum.description: Excellent display of material from the site, including lovely sculpture and a superb epigraphic collection
museum.address: Contrada santa maria delle palate, 98079 - Tusa (ME)

bibl.author: Prag and Tigano
bibl.title: Alesa Archonidea: il lapidarium
bibl.citation: J.R.W. Prag and G. Tigano, Alesa Archonidea: Il Lapidarium, Introduzione All’archeologia Di Halaesa 8 (Palermo: Regione Siciliana, Assessorato beni culturali e identità siciliana, Dipartimento beni culturali e identità siciliana, 2017)

keywords: theodoros offers a dedication to serapis
